TITLE: Police: High-powered handgun used in Vegas officer killing
SUMMARY: A police official says a man accused of killing a veteran Las Vegas patrol officer fired 18 shots with a gun described as an “AK-47 pistol,” including one that penetrated the officer’s ballistic vest and one that wounded the man’s mother-in-law in the leg

TITLE: US businesses propose hiding trade data used to trace abuse
SUMMARY: A group of major U.S. businesses wants the government to hide key import data -- a move trade experts say would make it more difficult for Americans to link the products they buy to labor abuse overseas

TITLE: Man convicted in death of Texas agency's 1st Sikh deputy
SUMMARY: A man has been convicted of capital murder in the 2019 shooting death of a law enforcement officer who was the first Sikh deputy in his Texas agency

TITLE: Remains found in Oklahoma river belong to 4 missing men
SUMMARY: Authorities say four Oklahoma men who were last seen riding their bicycles more than a week ago were shot and dismembered

TITLE: Drivers shoot daughters in Florida road rage confrontation
SUMMARY: Two men face attempted murder charges for allegedly firing into each other’s vehicles on a busy Florida highway and wounding each other’s daughters, who were passengers in their back seats

TITLE: Truck hits 2 Ole Miss students, killing 1; suspects arrested
SUMMARY: One University of Mississippi student was killed and another was injured when a pickup truck struck them in a parking lot early Sunday behind Oxford City Hall

TITLE: Man arrested in serial killings has criminal history
SUMMARY: A man suspected of killing six men and wounding a woman in a series of shootings in Northern California has a criminal history that includes traffic violations and convictions for drug crimes

TITLE: Kansas to search grounds of former Native American school
SUMMARY: The Kansas Historical Society plans to search the grounds of a former Native American boarding school to determine if any children were buried there

TITLE: Reputed drug dealer accused of raping informant jumps bail
SUMMARY: A reputed drug dealer accused of raping a woman police informant sent into his house in an unmonitored sting has skipped bail and was a no-show at what was supposed to the start of his trial

TITLE: NJ casino, sports betting, online revenue up 7% in September
SUMMARY: New Jersey’s casinos, horse tracks that offer sports betting and the online partners of both types of gambling outlets won nearly $485 million from gamblers in September, up nearly 7% from a year earlier

TITLE: What we know about the Raleigh shooting victims
SUMMARY: Details about the five people killed in a mass shooting in North Carolina are continuing to trickle out

TITLE: California stabbing suspect arrested after 1 killed, 3 hurt
SUMMARY: Southern California police say a man with a knife has been arrested following a series of stabbings that killed a woman and wounded three others

TITLE: Up to 20 arrested after striking truckers block plant exits
SUMMARY: Police say as many as 20 people were arrested when striking truckers used tractor-trailers to block the exits at New England’s largest wholesale food distributor

TITLE: Officials: 2 dead after plane crash in Florida neighborhood
SUMMARY: Officials say two occupants of a small plane died after crashing into a house in a South Florida neighborhood

TITLE: Judge dismisses lawsuit over upcoming lethal injection
SUMMARY: A federal judge has dismissed an inmate’s claim seeking to block his upcoming execution in Alabama because of reported problems at a recent lethal injection

TITLE: Attorney: Don't set execution amid lethal injection lawsuit
SUMMARY: A Mississippi inmate's attorney says the state should not set an execution date for her client because the inmate is part of an ongoing federal lawsuit that challenges the state's execution method

TITLE: Clean Water Act at 50: environmental gains, challenges unmet
SUMMARY: Fifty years ago, Congress passed the Clean Water Act to protect U.S. waterways from abuses like the oily industrial pollution that caused Ohio's Cuyahoga River to catch on fire in 1969

TITLE: UN chief: war in Ethiopia's Tigray must end, Eritrea exit
SUMMARY: The United Nations chief is demanding an immediate end to hostilities in Ethiopia’s northern Tigray region and withdrawal of Eritrean forces fighting alongside the government

TITLE: Body of woman found in crashed car that of teen driver's mom
SUMMARY: Authorities say the body of a woman found in the trunk of a car that crashed in south-central Nebraska during a police chase was the mother of the teenage driver

TITLE: Bear mauls 10-year-old in grandparentsâ€™ Connecticut backyard
SUMMARY: Authorities say a 250-pound black bear mauled a 10-year-old boy playing in his grandparents’ backyard in Connecticut and tried to drag him away before the animal was fatally shot by police

TITLE: 3 weeks after Ian's landfall, students returning to school
SUMMARY: Almost three weeks after Hurricane Ian made landfall in southwest Florida, students in the area’s largest school district are poised to return to class

TITLE: Radioactive waste found at Missouri elementary school
SUMMARY: Environmental investigation consultants have found significant radioactive contamination at an elementary school in suburban St. Louis where nuclear weapons were produced during World War II

TITLE: Landmark trial begins over Arkansas' ban on trans youth care
SUMMARY: The nation's first trial over a state's ban on gender-confirming care for children begins in Arkansas this week

TITLE: Credit Suisse pays $495M tied to mortgage-backed securities
SUMMARY: Credit Suisse has agreed to pay $495 million as part of a settlement with the U.S. over a yearslong dispute tied to mortgage-backed securities, an investment vehicle that played a central role in the 2008 financial crisis

TITLE: Today in History: October 17, Einstein arrives in the U.S.
SUMMARY: Today in History
